test/workloop_t.cpp

00001 // $Id: workloop__t_8cpp-source.html,v 1.1.2.1 2009/01/30 11:03:19 mommsen Exp $
00002 
00003 // Test script to demonstrate the use of xdaq workloops
00004 // Documentation at https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/XdaqWiki/WebHome?topic=workloop
00005 
00006 #include "toolbox/task/WorkLoopFactory.h"
00007 #include "toolbox/task/WaitingWorkLoop.h"
00008 #include "toolbox/task/Action.h"
00009 #include "toolbox/lang/Class.h"
00010 #include "toolbox/net/URN.h"
00011 
00012 #include <iostream>
00013 #include <unistd.h>
00014 
00015 class WorkloopTest : public toolbox::lang::Class
00016 {
00017 public:
00018   
00019   WorkloopTest()
00020   {
00021     // Get 2 work loops
00022     _fragmentCollectorWorkloop = 
00023       toolbox::task::getWorkLoopFactory()->getWorkLoop("FragmentCollectorWorkloop", "polling");
00024 
00025     _dqmProcessorWorkloop = 
00026       toolbox::task::getWorkLoopFactory()->getWorkLoop("DqmProcessorWorkloop", "polling");
00027 
00028 
00029     // Define actions    
00030     toolbox::task::ActionSignature* processFragmentQueueAction = 
00031       toolbox::task::bind(this, &WorkloopTest::processFragmentQueue, "ProcessFragmentQueue");
00032     
00033     toolbox::task::ActionSignature* processCommandQueueAction = 
00034       toolbox::task::bind(this, &WorkloopTest::processCommandQueue, "ProcessCommandQueue");
00035     
00036     toolbox::task::ActionSignature* processDQMEventQueueAction = 
00037       toolbox::task::bind(this, &WorkloopTest::processDQMEventQueue, "ProcessDQMEventQueue");
00038 
00039 
00040     // Add actions to workloops
00041     _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->submit(processFragmentQueueAction);
00042     _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->submit(processCommandQueueAction);
00043 
00044     _dqmProcessorWorkloop->submit(processDQMEventQueueAction);
00045     
00046     
00047     // Activate the workloops
00048     // Note: activating an active workloop throws toolbox::task::exception::Exception
00049     if ( ! _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->isActive() )
00050     {
00051       _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->activate();
00052     }
00053     if ( ! _dqmProcessorWorkloop->isActive() )
00054     {
00055       _dqmProcessorWorkloop->activate();
00056     }
00057   }
00058 
00059 
00060   ~WorkloopTest()
00061   {
00062     _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->cancel();
00063     _dqmProcessorWorkloop->cancel();
00064 
00065     // Do we need to remove the workloop from the factory, too?
00066     // This interface is awkward.
00067     toolbox::net::URN urn1("toolbox-task-workloop", _fragmentCollectorWorkloop->getName());
00068     toolbox::task::getWorkLoopFactory()->removeWorkLoop(urn1);
00069 
00070     toolbox::net::URN urn2("toolbox-task-workloop", _dqmProcessorWorkloop->getName());
00071     toolbox::task::getWorkLoopFactory()->removeWorkLoop(urn2);
00072   }
00073   
00074 
00075 private:
00076   
00077   bool processFragmentQueue(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
00078   {
00079     std::cout << "Processing a I2O fragment" << std::endl;
00080     ::sleep(1);
00081     return true; // go on
00082   }
00083 
00084   
00085   bool processCommandQueue(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
00086   {
00087     std::cout << "Processing a state machine command" << std::endl;
00088     ::sleep(5);
00089     return true; // go on
00090   }
00091 
00092   
00093   bool processDQMEventQueue(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
00094   {
00095     std::cout << "Processing a DQM event" << std::endl;
00096     ::sleep(1);
00097     return true; // go on
00098   }
00099 
00100   
00101   toolbox::task::WorkLoop* _fragmentCollectorWorkloop;
00102   toolbox::task::WorkLoop* _dqmProcessorWorkloop;
00103 
00104   
00105 };
00106 
00107 int main ()
00108 {
00109   WorkloopTest *t = new WorkloopTest();
00110   ::sleep(30);
00111   delete t;
00112   return 0;
00113 }
00114
